text:
I am getting some pretty nasty errors showing in my event log from apache, a 
restart fixes it for a few hours, but once server loads get high again, they 
start to appear again.

Here are the 2 errors which appear, any ideas on specific settings I should be 
using for Win32 at all? i've searched through newsgroups and docs and cant 
find any reference to the errors.

-------------------------------------------------------------
Event Type:	Error
Event Source:	COM+
Event Category:	Executive
Event ID:	4199
Date:		18/03/2003
Time:		02:21:07
User:		N/A
Computer:	NUSWEB1
Description:
The COM+ Services DLL (comsvcs.dll) was unable to load because allocation of 
thread local storage failed. Process Name: Apache.exe Error Code = 
0x80070008 : Not enough storage is available to process this command.
COM+ Services Internals Information:
File: .\comsvcs.cpp, Line: 289
-------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------
Event Type:	Error
Event Source:	COM+
Event Category:	SVC
Event ID:	4194
Date:		18/03/2003
Time:		10:08:06
User:		N/A
Computer:	NUSWEB1
Description:
The system has called a custom component and that component has failed and 
generated an exception. This indicates a problem with the custom component. 
Notify the developer of this component that a failure has occurred and provide 
them with the information below. 
Component Prog ID: SC.Pool 2 2
Method Name: IDispenserDriver::CreateResource
Process Name: Apache.exe
The serious nature of this error has caused the process to terminate.
Exception: C0000005
Address: 0x753807DC
Call Stack: 
sqloledb + 0x107DC
sqloledb + 0x5680
oledb32!DllGetClassObject + 0x1919
COMSVCS!DispManGetContext(unsigned long *,unsigned long *) + 0xB27
COMSVCS!DispManGetContext(unsigned long *,unsigned long *) + 0x163F
 + 0xAE06728
 + 0x99E5C4B7
-------------------------------------------------------------
creator: carl@voodoomedia.co.uk
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Apache itself doesn't rely on COM - so these errors must be in some add-in
  module (3rd party apache module or isapi extention.)  Please consult with
  that 3rd party author to help diagnose your issue.

  It seems you are using some sql module?  If so, that's probably the author
  you need to contact.
